Solution Parent step: 14
Check in tab
Updated 23Feb, 2023
Feature Overview:  Live date: 26 Jan,
2023
Markets: ALL
This feature provides the passengers with information about the Check-in product. There are two scenarios 
here:
1. not purchased check-in
The passengers haven't purchased the Check-in product. In that case, inside the Check-in tab there will be 
available information on how to purchase the product (if it is possible) and how to check-in themselves 
manually:

App Check-in: Here the passengers can ﬁnd information on how to request the check-in product via 
App. The App check-in is a cost free service.
Check-in Service: Here the passengers can ﬁnd information on how to purchase the check-in product via 
the Web site.
Self check-in: Here the passengers can ﬁnd information on how to check-in themselves manually. There 
is an itinerary of the trip showing the reference number (booking number), the airline and the email 
address that should be used per ﬂight or group of ﬂights in order to check themselves in.
2. Purchased check-in
The passengers have purchased the check-in product either via the App or the Web site. In that case the 
passengers should be able to see their check-in status per segment and per passenger, a section with 
information about their baggage and an FAQ section with common questions regarding the check-in.

Check-in status
1. Already checked in
2. Check-in status before registration in passNFly
When the passengers request the check-in service for a speciﬁc order, the system tries initially try to register 
this order in passNFly. In case the ﬁrst attempt fails, we try to register 2 more times. This process may take up 
to 10 minutes. If the registration fails even after these 3 attempts the request goes to a queue and needs to 
be manually resolved (instructions will be shared in a diﬀerent article). During this time we show the check-in 
status for all passengers as pending. 

3. Failed check-in 
If the registration failure has still not been resolved until the check-in window opens (e.g. 24 hours before the 
departure), then the check-in status is updated to failed and we prompt the passengers to manually check-in 
themselves.
The check-in can fail for multiple reasons. It could be either due to passNFly internal issues etc. (FAILED 
status in passNFly) or some missing traveler documents for the passengers (SUSPENED status in passNFly). 
On our side, for all these failures we show "Failed check-in" text as the passenger's status, but we provide 
more information next to it.

4. Check-in status when temporary server error occurs
In case of communication error with passNFly (server error on their side etc), we display the itinerary of the 
trip but at the same time inform the passengers that their check-in status is temporarily unavailable.
**** if a customer calls and requests info about the check-in , the FL agents can login to the Myportal to
check the status of the check-in. In this case, there is no need to escalate the request through the op-supp-
ancillaries slack channel. 
Please keep in mind that :
App check-in - will be available only on 3 main brands (Mytrip, Flightnetwork and Gotogate).
Check-in Service - only for those trips where we o�er the check-in service for purchase.
Self check-in guidelines - will be available for all

input:
Exported at by Swarna Mallik

Fare rules in case of multiple combinations
Guidelines on how to proceed in case of multiple fares combination in one ticket.
1. Fare rules in case of multiple combination
2. Penalty per pricing unit
3. Penalty per fare component
Step 1 - Starting point
Question No linked steps
Before checking the fare rules, make sure you have tried the Edvin refund calculator.
General information the agents should take into consideration:
-Fare rules interpretation : How does the penalty apply 
Penalty for cancellation/refund (nothing more speci�c is mentioned in the fare rules) :  the penalty
applies per pricing unit 
Penalty per transaction :  the penalty applies  per pricing unit  
"Cancellation
                   Charge 50 EUR" : the penalty applies  per pricing unit
Penalty per bound/per coupon/per sector/per fare component/per direction :  the penalty applies per
mentioned entity, meaning per bound/per coupon/per sector/per fare component/per direction
-How to combine the fares when nothing speci�c is mentioned in the fare rules:
if there is only one pricing unit, the strictest penalty of all applicable according to the fare rules is to be
charged
if there are 2 ( or more) pricing units, both penalties are to be charged, the strictest within each pricing
unit.
Fare rules in case of multiple combination
1. Penalty per pricing unit Step 2
2. Penalty per fare component Step 3
Step 2
Solution Parent step: 1
Penalty per pricing unit
 Before checking the fare rules, make sure you have tried the Edvin refund calculator.
In order to ﬁnd the number of pricing units follow the instructions in this link.
Attention:If the rules do not specify that the strictest penalty applies to the entire ticket or all pricing units,they should be treated separately.
-Scenario 1: One pricing unit is non refundable
    1. Open ticket record
   2. Check fare rules  
VNCLE:
CANCELLATIONS
   TICKET IS NON-REFUNDABLE IN CASE OF NO-SHOW.ANY TIME
      TICKET IS NON-REFUNDABLE IN CASE OF CANCEL/REFUND.
         QNCDE00:
CANCELLATIONS .
ANY TIME CHARGE EUR 150.00 FOR CANCEL/REFUND. REFUND RULES APPLY PER PRICING UNIT.
    3. Calculate total penalty
The ﬁrst pricing unit is non refundable so we need to deduct the amount based on NUC calculation 
283.68NUC referring to the 1st pricing unit is not refundable (VNCLE). Convert the non-refundable cost to 
EUR: 283.68NUC*ROE0.875971=248.49545328 , round it up to 249EUR
The 2nd pricing unit has a penalty of 150EUR(QNCDE00).
So, the total penalty will be 249+150=399EUR 
Remember to inform the customer that some taxes may not be refundable and about our fee.

-Scenario 2: Diﬀerent penalty for each pricing unit
       1. Open ticket record
        2. Check fare rules
KREMSO:
CANCELLATIONS   
     ANY TIME
       CHARGE USD 75.00 FOR CANCEL/REFUND.
KLREEGO:
CANCELLATIONS
     ANY TIME
       CHARGE USD 100.00 FOR CANCEL/REFUND.
GW6LUCTG:
CANCELLATIONS
     ANY TIME
       CHARGE USD 50.00 FOR CANCEL/REFUND.
       3. Calculate total penalty
There are 3 pricing units, so all penalties will apply.
The 1rst pricing unit has a penalty of 75.00 USD (KREMSO)

The 2nd pricing unit has a penalty of 100.00 USD (KLREEGO)
The 3rd pricing unit has a penalty of 50.00 USD (GW6LUCTG)
So, the total penalty will be 75.00 +100.00 + 50.00 = 225.00 USD 
Remember to inform the customer that some taxes may not be refundable and about our fee.
** The fare basis and the fare rules mentioned above have been created as an example and might not be
re�ecting the respective fare rules in reality. The agent should always check the fare rules in GDS. 
Step 3
Solution Parent step: 1
Penalty per fare component
Before checking the fare rules, make sure you have tried the Edvin refund calculator.
 In order to ﬁnd the number of fare components follow the instructions in this link.
1. Open ticket record.
2. Check fare rules
ZDYY5L:
 CANCELLATIONS ANY TIME
  CHARGE EUR 20.00 FOR CANCEL/REFUND.
ZDYY4L
CANCELLATIONS TICKET IS NON-REFUNDABLE IN CASE OF NO-SHOW.
 ANY TIME

      TICKET IS NON-REFUNDABLE IN CASE OF CANCEL/REFUND.
   WHEN COMBINING NON-REFUNDABLE FARES WITH A
          REFUNDABLE FARES
          1-THE AMOUNT PAID ON EACH REFUNDABLE
          FARE COMPONENT IS REFUNDED
          2-THE AMOUNT PAID ON EACH NON-REFUNDABLE FARE
          COMPONENT WILL NOT BE REFUNDED
          3-WHEN COMBINING FARES CHARGE THE SUM
          OF THE CANCELLATION FEES OF ALL CANCELLED FARE
          COMPONENTS
  3. Calculate the total penalty 
Refundable fare basis ZDYY5L corresponds to 27.50EUR( or 28EUR as it is always rounded up in the FARE 
row in the ticket) in fare calculation, non-refundable fare basis ZDYY4L corresponds to 20.00EUR in fare 
calculation.
The calculation of the total penalty is as follows
20 non-refundable fare + 20 penalty=40EUR
Since the penalty is lower than the amount of 48EUR fare, you can tell the customer that the airline charges 
a 40EUR penalty, plus we apply our fee. 
Remember to inform the customer that some taxes may not be refundable.

request type (ex. name change, ancillary, etc), there is an extra fee of 3% which is added to the total price and
appears in the last step of payment.
Therefore, we need to charge the customers 3% as an additional fee in the total price when we are using our
corporate cards, otherwise, the price we collect from the passenger will be less than the price we are paying
to the airlines.

instruction: Summarize Dupe RL Jiras - Identifying Dupe Jiras.txt
input:
What is a dupe Jira :
Duplicate Jira is considered the Jira that is raised for the same order and for exactly the same human error.  
Which Jira should be closed as dupe :
Generally speaking, the Jira created last is the one that should be closed as “Dupe”. 
Exceptions: 
If one of the  Jiras is unassigned and the other is assigned, the unassigned one should be closed as
Dupe, no matter which was raised �rst. 
If one of the  Jiras is already approved, then the other Jira should be closed as Dupe no matter which was
raised �rst.
In case you notice that there is dupe RL Jira, link the Jiras and close the one according to these criteria by
selecting the option "Dupe Jira" in order to turn the status to “ Dupe“. Attention: If the dupe Jira is assigned to
another agent, link the two Jiras and contact the agent (or leave a comment in the dupe Jira for them) so that
they close the Jira.  
How to link  Jiras
1. At the top of the  RL Jira, just below the title there is the option to Link an issue, as marked in the
screenshot below:
 
2. Select “duplicates”  in the �rst box and add in the box next to it the RL number of the Jira that is still open
to be handled:
3. Click on “Link” 
Disclaimer: The steps mentioned above are the ones to follow when you choose to "Link issue" in the dupe RL
Jira that will not be handled and will be closed with the status “Dupe”. Otherwise, in case you choose to "Link
issue" in the other RL Jira (that will not be closed ) select the reason “is duplicated by”  in step 2.

Please follow the below guidelines on how to use Edvin Refund Calculator (ATC).

as shown below.

if the booking is eligible for refund(check Edvin docs and fare rules), communicate airlines penalties, ETG fees
if applicable, etc. 
3. The tool will automatically calculate the refundable amount and provide results based on the date of the
order and date of customer's request for cancellation. 
You may receive more than one o�er results such as Void and 24h airline rule or 24h airline rule and Ticket
rules, in such case you must always provide to the customer the o�er with the highest amount.
You will also have a deadline when this refundable amount can be provided based on the ‘’Expires’’ �eld.
For example, if the booking is eligible for refund due to void, the refundable amount will indicate ‘’VOID’’ as
cancellation reason in the ‘’Source �eld’’ as shown below and this o�er is available until 25JUN23. 

The deadline for customers to con�rm cancellation is ALWAYS the previous day before departure, thus always
you must check if any restrictions occur, i.e. 24h rule.
In case the order is not eligible for Void, Edvin Calculator will calculate the potential refundable amount
based on ATC functionality.
  
 Please note when you click on the button ‘’Show items’’ you will �nd the breakdown of the refundable amount
including the penalty that is applicable by the airline in the customer's currency and in GDS currency.
Consequently, you should not check fare rules in GDS, the refund calculator will give you the airlines penalty.
4. Inform the customer about the total refundable amount as shown in the ‘’Total’’ �eld. For email/chat
communication use the applicable templates/scripts. 
5. If a customer decides to cancel the order, copy the airline penalty amount  in the GDS currency as it must
be inserted in the ‘’Modify order'' wizard. The airline penalty is visible when you click on ''Show items''. 
6.  Use the ‘’Modify order’’ button with the applicable cancellation reason.
7. Send the applicable cancellation con�rmation email template from Edvin. The templates have  blank
�elds which need to be updated manually. All related templates are available in the folder ‘’ATC Refund
Calculator’’. The folder is located under First Line-> Cancellation. Same location is under’’ Booking.com’’
templates. 
8. As soon  as all actions are completed by First Line, the claim of the tickets will be done automatically
based on the ATC capabilities and without human interference from Second Line.

General information about Edvin Refund Calculator
For Booking.com -Step by step for Edvin Calculator here.
Edvin Calculator(ATC)  is a tool in Edvin, located in the ‘’Refund tab’’ and can be used only for original active
orders (not changed/not canceled/no past reservations/no same-day departure).
This feature automatically calculates the total refundable amount that the customer will receive if we proceed
with canceling the order.
The tool might give more than 2 results based on ATC for example both Void and 24h airline rule, agents must
always provide to the customer with the o�er with the higher amount. 
The tool is based on the Amadeus automatic (ATC) and Sabre Automated Refund (AR) refund capabilities.
For any airline that is eligible for ATC and has been con�gured in Edvin, we can see the �nal total refundable
amount which is accurate and guaranteed to be refunded to the customer.
The tool will calculate the total refundable amount on PNR level and per customer as shown below.
 
For Sabre Automated Refund(AR) below will be the response in Edvin calculator with a refund o�er and
cancellation reason “Ticket rules - airline fee”

Edvin calculator is designed to deduct penalties/ETG fees and all amounts that are not refundable( taxes,
markups, any other non-refundable products, etc.).
The total refundable amount (including tax refund) must be communicated to the customer for clarity and a
conscious decision if they want to proceed with the cancellation.

Amadeus/Sabre reservations and only for the airlines con�gured in Edvin.

Tickets issued via Farelogix for Lufthansa Group airlines (LHG), and we can modify the order for Void,
Ticket rules - airline fee and 24h rule, from Edvin without needing to take action in Farelogix, as the self-
service mechanism covers that.
Tickets issued by Amadeus NDCx for Scenarios : VOID, Refund by rules.
 
For all the sy

Always split out the person(s) who want to make the changes/cancellations.
Make the split before you make the changes/cancellation, but do not save before the passenger con�rms
rebooking/cancellation.
Use ‘Link pnr’ in Edvin to note the new pnr reference.
Note the new pnr reference in the original pnr and the original reference in the new pnr.
How to make a split
Amadeus Sabre
Split SP1 – for pax 1, SP3,5 – for pax 3 and 5.
EF – end and �le.
ER
You will come back to original PNR.
Do RTAXR or MB to see split PNR reference.  
D1 – for pax 1, D3*5 – for pax 3 and 5.
6 – your name.
F – end and �le
ER
*D to see split PNR reference.
Please note:
Due to a technical issue with the record locator ensure correct Split Procedure is done with TK.
After PNR split, ensure to get the Airline Record Locator prior to any further changes/cancellations in
both (original / split) PNR.
Do not make any modi�cations to a PNR in the same transaction as a split. 
If we have a TK booking without recloc then we need to contact the airline to make a split in their system.
Then we will be able to make IR and recloc will come in automatically.

On a go forward, when we receive a name correction or name change request from anyone who has booked
through the following 4 sites, we MUST initiate the name correction/change with the airline.
A change to a di�erent passenger is not permitted except if the airline's policy allows it. 
 
Gotogate BR 
Mytrip BR
Flightnetwork BR
Booking.com BR
As per Brazil’s legislation (ANAC, art. 8) they have mandated the requirement of reaching out to the airline in
writing whenever a  name correction or change is being requested. 
Important points to keep in mind…
 
Whether or not the airline is able to do the name correction or name change, we must inquire with the
airline in writing so we have it on record that we initiated the request
Our naco/nach fee will always apply, regardless if the airline cost is FOC
You should charge our service fees only if the name correction/change has been approved by the airline,
along with airline cost for the correction. No fees shall be prepaid before we are sure that the name
correction/change is possible.
Majority of the name correction/change will be for Gol Linhas Aéreas G3, Latam LA, Azul Airlines AD &
LATAM Airlines Brasil JJ.
For LCC bookings, where in Edvin documents it is stated that we should NEVER
contact the airline, please refer the customers to the airline directly.
For all other booking sources including Consolid, we must assist with the naco/nach, follow the normal
routines

We o�er approximately 250 di�erent LCC airlines on our websites. The reservations can be made via

Step 6
Solution No linked steps
OTRS
When the customer completes a booking and has booked their ﬂight with an LCC airline, we create alias email
addresses to access their bookings (exceptions apply, check at the bottom of the page). This means that when
the airline sends emails regarding anything (from advertisements to schedule changes), we receive them and
not the customer. We can therefore select which emails to forward to the customer and which not to.  
The email address used can be found on the conﬁrmation email or under the LCC tab in Edvin. 
Conﬁrmation email :
LCC tab in Edvin: 
This way, we receive many emails and the ones that are important for the passenger to have are being resent
to the passenger from this OTRS email. The booking con�rmation is sent as usual from Edvin to all these
customers.
If we have received an email from the airline regarding the LCC Booking, we are able to see it in Edvin under
the OTRS Tab:
Under "latest action" we can see if the email has been forwarded to the customer or not, and also the
category shows what kind of information we have sent to the customer. 
We can click on the subject line of the email and a new tab will open up where we can see the email that has
been sent to the customer. 
You can request from Ancillary team to resend the email from OTRS to pax, using slack room #op-supp-
ancillaries
For OU teams, please escalate to OUT Support through the Service desk.
***Attention*** 
The Alias email is not created for all the LCC (for example Ryanair is excluded etc).
In order to recognize if the booking was made with an Alias email or with the customer's actual email
address, go to the con�rmation email and check which email address do we provide to the customer for
check-in.
If it is the same email address as the one inserted in Edvin's contact details then it means that no Alias email
was created for this order. Instead, we used directly the customer's email address to make the booking.
Therefore, no emails will have been received in the OTRS.

--- Step by step----
1.To check the price for baggage ﬁrst select the wanted ﬂights by marking the “boxes” under itinerary and
then click on “services”:
2.Then choose baggage for the required passenger(s) ob, ib or both, then press continue.
3. We always have to see that the baggage is conﬁrmed (HD) before sending payment link to the passenger,
this can take a couple of minutes.
4. When baggage is HD we send payment link to passenger:
always multiply the baggage price in sprk with the correct mark-up (check the correct markup in the main 
menu, in point 1) Ancillaries and Services List ) and choose product: 
Note: If the passenger decides against continuing with the SRR and it has been saved, it may not be deleted. In this
case, you can reach out to the carrier for assistance.
5. When passenger has paid the payment link on the phone we have to issue baggage in sprk on the spot.
If passenger wants to pay later, we do not send it on any queue to ticketing in this stage, once PL is paid it will
appear on support who will ﬁnishes the issue themselves in sprk.
6. When payment is collected
Create a VAN card in Edvin
When VAN card is created go back to FLX: 
7. Choose the traveler that you want to issue baggage for and press next:
Under Fare groups/services it is very important that we do NOT click in the "Check all fare groups" or any
ﬂight segments. - if you do this you will issue the tickets again and we (ETG) will pay for passengers ticket
again to the airline. 
Only check the boxes for the baggage that you want to issue and press next. 
Click on show next to "forms of payment". 
We always have to change the payment method to VAN by pressing the blue/green arrows. 
 
After payment method has been manually changed press issue documents: 
8. If all these steps has been followed correctly you will be able to see the baggage EMD number on the end
oﬀ the page: 
9. After baggage is issued in SPRK we always register errand in Edvin per usual. No need to queue to ticketing
or UPA TKT- "Close D365 External portals" queue as agent has already issued the EMD.  
10. Send conﬁrmation email to the customer from Edvin and register errand with detailed notes.

Manual Rebooking of partially used tickets.
If pnr has been partly used you must follow the below steps. 
Check the fare rules of the ticket for rebooking conditions. 
1. Add the new �ights in the PNR by selecting “Add air”.
2. Click on "One Way" as you only need to search for the return �ight.
Add the departure and arrival airport, rebooking date, and click on "Air availability"
3. Choose the same booking class if available, or if not available, you need to choose the next available
higher bookings class, (the fare can't be lower than the original fare.) Click on the shopping cart to add
the segments. 
4. Now you need to price the rebooking.
Select the �own segment and the new one and click on "Price".
5.  Select "Current classes" and ALWAYS click on the checkbox "Historical pricing".  
      Then click on "Pricing by brands" (for selecting the correct fare family) & choose the "Validating Carrier".
      Then click on "Continue".
6. At the next step, select the passengers/tickets you want to rebook and click on "Continue"
7. In the next step you need to �ll in the date of issuance of the ticket you want to rebook. You may just click
on the pre-selected date and will be automatically �lled. Click on "Continue".
**ATTENTION** In case the ticket has already been rebooked once you need to double-check the correct date
of the last round trip ticket that was valid.
 
8. Next step is the Optional Services. You may skip this step by clicking on Continue.
9. At the �nal step you should get the pricing.
***ATTENTION*** If you get the below error message (No fares found for booking class-Try other
options) instead of pricing, go back to step 5 and select "Best Available". Make sure to again select "Historical
Pricing".
Repeat the process until step 9 and you will get the pricing. 
10. Now you need to compare the fare and taxes (one by one) with the original ticket.

instruction: Summarize Nach requests when booking under the void window.txt
input:
How to handle Infant Naco/Nach requests when booking under the void window
Description: In case the customer contacts us for NACO/NACH about INF (infant) passenger while void is still
possible. We will propose to issue a new ticket for Infant and Adult tickets who are associated with Infant,
while we are voiding the old tickets with the wrong name.
Step by step for void & new ticket:
1. Check if a void is possible and if it is in a void window. If the booking is out of the Void window or not
possible to void, follow the NACO general process mentioned in Shelf and Edvin Docs. 
2. If Void is possible; Check the availability for the same �ights before advising the Void option.
3. Inform the customer of the applicable fare di�erence for both passenger Infant and Adult tickets who are
associated with Infant (Our fees for both Adult and infant will not be charged). The new ticket fare di�erence
should be calculated with the original ticket fare and taxes. Collect the payment via Moto during the call or via
the Payment link. Also, collect the passport copy or identity card copy from the passenger via etrack.
Attn: Inform the customer that providing the correct spelling on the call is their responsibility. Otherwise, the
customer must submit the relevant document.
4. Once we receive the payment from the customer, Split the Adult on whom the Infant is associated if
needed (If there is more than one Adult) and link the PNR in Edvin.
5. Void the original ticket of the Infant and associated Adult and cancel the segments in the original PNR.
In this case, we do not refund to the customer (Do not run the modify Order).
6. Create a new PNR for both passengers (Infant and Adult) with the correct name, also add passenger docs
information, and link the PNR in Edvin. 
7. Send the new PNR to the ticketing using the'' Ticketing template'' from register errands for a new ticket
name change. Select template TKT info name change (Amadeus/Sabre/Galileo).
8. Put on queue in Edvin in order to send the booking to BOM TKT (Name Change and Add Infant only).

9. Remove the payment link and Change the status of the order to a name change or name correction -
change.

General Information
Di�erence between refunds in BSP and GDS
If it is possible we prefer to apply for a refund directly via Amadeus or Sabre (GDS). We need written
authorization in the PNR if it is not against normal penalties (for example exceptions like travel alerts andschedule changes).
In some cases, we need to apply for the refunds via BSP and then we have to calculate with a lot longerrefund time (therefore it is of most importance with written authorizations for exceptions).
See this link to see what we refund in di�erent situations:
Refund due to di�erent situations- All Markets
Fare breakdowns
Sometimes a customer contacts us to have a fare breakdown on their refund.
BO refunds will help the customer with this.
UPA and ATH FL agents need to put the order in Etrack through the Contact form,  and the BO support agentwill inform the customer via email from Edvin.
 
WNS agents send an urgent refund request through Etrack.
FL agent informs the customer that our refund department will respond within 48 hrs.
Examples and explanation of RX-lines from Backo�ce:
1.
67 RX ***08JUN.ATT BO: FULL REFUND OK IN AMA SE TKT 657 8931241817 SEK 1240//MARIA L68 RX ***08JUN.ATT BO: TAX REFUND OK IN AMA SE TKT 8931241831 SEK 179//MARIA L69 RX ***24JUN RFD OK GBP 253,18 TO CCOGONE // CAMILLA
The above means that on the 8th of June the �rst step in the refund was made. Internal invoice, ticket notissued in the same country as booked. No refund was made to the passenger.
The actual refund was made to the passenger on 24th of June.
2. 
64 RX ***SG3***-W///16APR. RA ISSUED 0460141762-64 /PETRA  65 RX ***SG3***-W///03JUN. RFD OK NOK 26900 TO DIBSMC/ANNIKA 
The above means that on the 16th of April we made a refund application to the airline. The refund applicationnumber can be given to the passenger if they want to contact the airline.
On the 3rd of June we made the actual refund to the passenger.
3. Please note that if only the following row is added:
64 RX ***SG3***-W///16APR. RA ISSUED 0460141762-64 /PETRA 
No refund has been made to the passenger. The handling time at the airline might be anywhere between 2-16 weeks after this (sometimes longer).If line 64 is the only line on RX line and there has been longer than 1 month since RA was made do thefollowing:
65 RX ***SG3***-W///15JUL. ATT BO PLS CHECK STATUS RA OR SEND REMINDER //CAMILLAN
Queue place the booking on queue 41C2 or 402 in the country of issue.We only o�er bank payment on markets SE, DE, FI, NL.
You may see this in Modify order as follows:
If it is a FI bank payment made in DIBS, we need bank information, IBAN/BIC.
You may verify if that is a DIB payment here:
Dibs is used for Finnish bank payments and is a system where we are unable to process the refund, thus wehave no account details from the passenger. 
In this case, to proceed with the refund, we need to provide BO agents with bank information, IBAN/BIC.
For the other markets, no information is needed.
Refund to Klarna (invoice)
If the customer has not yet paid the invoice to Klarna, the invoice will be adjusted and BO refunds willemail a new, updated invoice to the customer.

Reissued ticket cancellation
Guidelines on verifying cancellation rules of reissued tickets by ETG
1. Reissued ticket cancellation
2. Amadeus/ Sabre voluntary reissued ticket
3. Involuntary reissued ticket
4. Amadeus involuntary reissued ticket
5. Sabre Involuntary reissued ticketd
Step 1 - Starting point
Question No linked steps
Reissued ticket cancellation
1. Voluntary reissued ticket Step 2
2. Involuntary reissued ticket Step 3
Step 2
Solution Parent step: 1
Amadeus/ Sabre voluntary reissued ticket
Voluntary reissued tickets
Both GDSs:
Please follow these steps in the mentioned order to proceed with handling the voluntary reissued ticket.
 
Check the rule of the ticket
When the ticket is voluntarily reissued it is by the choice of the passenger. This means that we need to 
check the rule of both the original ticket and the new ticket to determine which penalty to charge for the 
refund. We have three scenarios:
Scenario 1 - Same penalty in the original ticket and the reissued ticket. Charge one penalty.
Scenario 2 - Di�erent penalties in the original ticket and the reissued ticket. Charge the strictest penalty.
Scenario 3 - The original ticket is nonrefundable and the reissued ticket has a penalty. Add the fare from 
the original nonrefundable ticket as used and add the penalty for the upgraded part.
What was the change fee?
The change fee is never refundable so we need to �gure out how we have paid for the change fee so that 
we can remove it from the refund mask. Here we also have three scenarios:
Scenario 1 - The change fee has been paid for separately on an EMD
Here we don't have to think about the change fee in the refund mask, we will just let the EMD be.
Scenario 2 - The change fee has been added as a tax.
Normal change fee taxes can be CP, OB, OA, XP, DU, BO and OD etc. Check Edvin, for most airlines the 
information is updated. Here we delete the applicable tax from the tax display in the refund mask.
Scenario 3 - The change fee is included in the fare of the new ticket.
If the amount of the change fee is not speci�ed in the remarks we have to check the rule of the original 
ticket to see how much the change fee was. Then we have to add that amount as the fare used in the 
refund mask.
Step 3
Question Parent step: 1
Involuntary reissued ticket
1. Amadeus Step 4
2. Sabre Step 5
Step 4
Solution Parent step: 3
Amadeus involuntary reissued ticket
In this example there is no amount after total, instead it says NO ADC which means no additional collect. We 
now know that there´s been no fare di�erence for this new ticket which indicates an involuntary reissue. It is 
visible in the bottom of the ticket calculation on the TOTAL amount row.
But to be absolutely sure we need to check the remarks and look for an EMD in the PNR. To check, use either 
RTF or RHFA to locate any possible additional EMD and ticket numbers. 
For involuntary reissued tickets with no ADC the form of payment (FP line, abbreviated to FOP) is always the 
same as the original ticket.
 
Refund of involuntary reissued ticket
When a ticket is reissued due to involuntary reasons we always try to �nd seats available in the same class, 
but if that is not possible the airline might give an authorization to upgrade the ticket. 
This could mean that the refund rules di�er between the original ticket and the reissued one. However since 
it is not by the choice of the passenger to change the ticket we will always go by the rules of the original ticket 
in this scenario.
Check the rules of the original ticket.
Try to access the original ticket from the history in the PNR using RHFA and TWD/TKT055-XXXXXXXX70. If you 
cannot access the ticket, check the original farebasis with  TTH command. More info on how to display the 
history of active/purged PNR can be found here.
Example on how to retrieve the original ticket issue date.
Whenever a ticket in Amadeus is reissued due to a previous Schedule change or Force Majeure without an 
additional collection, eventually we need to cancel the reservation upon the customer’s request according 
to the fare rules:
1. If the usual ways to check the fare rules do not work(FQP ﬂow, backdate pricing, or FQD command), 
usually that is because the date of issue is incorrect in our command.
2. To ﬁnd the original ticket date, check the FO line inside the new ticket or the date when the original TST 
was created:

Or
Let’s see the diﬀerence:
After trying FQP ﬂow:

Or FQD command:
FQDFRADLM/ATK/D14SEP22/R,20AUG22/CJ
None of the results is matching us.
But once we update the date of issuance:

We get the correct farebasis on option 2.
Now, we can proceed with retrieving and interpreting the penalty rule.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
If the refund is due to schedule change or force majeure, you do not need to check the ticket rules.
Step 5

Sabre Involuntary reissued ticketd
Sabre: 
In this example there is no amount after total, instead, it says NOADC which means no additional cost has 
been collected. 
We now know that there´s been no fare di�erence for this new ticket which indicates an involuntary reissue. 
But to be absolutely sure we need to check the remarks and look for an EMD in the PNR. In Sabre, you can 
easily see if you have any EMDs as they will show in the ticket list when you use command *T. They are 
indicated as a ME before the ticket/EMD number.

There is no EMD in this PNR and according to the remarks on RX-lines and in Edvin order notes, the ticket has 
clearly been reissued due to involuntary reasons (schedule change or force majeure).

How to handle customers baggage and seat requests
This is a quick guide stating the steps you should take when the customer claims that has not received the
con�rmation email for the baggage/seating. 
DISCLAIMER: For VI Booking, please ensure to check if the time between the two �ights is su�cient for us to
add baggage. For more information please check the Baggage addition request
1. Check if the customer added the bag/seat during the booking �ow or post-sale. 
     a) Bag/seat added during the booking �ow. 
          That means that the customer does not receive a separate con�rmation email. The initial con�rmation
email includes ALL the relevant information for the itinerary and the purchased add-ons. 
Example:
Instead of escalating these requests via slack op-supp-ancillaries, open the order in the related system
(GDS/LCC/portal) to verify the ancillary.  
Inform the customer that the bag/seat was successfully issued and guide him where to �nd this information
in the con�rmation email. 
ATTENTION: When the ancillary is not issued automatically, the order falls to the Manual queue. In this case,
check if the order ended up to the Manual queue and do NOT  escalate the cases through the slack
channel op-supp-ancillaries. The ful�llment team handles the orders with priority based on the departure
date/time. 
When the ancillary is issued manually, the Ful�llment team does not send a separate con�rmation email
because we do not want to confuse the customer since the add-on was purchased in the booking �ow.. 
If the ancillary cannot be issued, the Ful�llment team places the order to the Refund Dashboard - Tech error
Ancillary, so the payouts team can process the refund only for the product’s value. 
  b) Bag/seat added post sale
Check if the order has been placed to the Manual queue. 
If yes, inform the customer to wait until to receive the con�rmation email from the Ful�llment team. 
If the order is not in any queue, open the order to the relevant system (GDS/LCC/portal) before escalating
the case to the slack channel op-supp-ancillaries to check if the ancillary was added. 
If the order is not in any queue and the ancillary has not been issued, you have to place the order to the
relevant queue and escalate the case to the relevant slack channel op-supp-ancillaries. 
For the occasions where the Ful�llment team forgot to send the con�rmation email to the customer, you can
escalate it via slack to the  op-supp-ancillaries.

input:

Created by Lisa Melo

1. FM Manual Rebooking Scenarios

Step 1 - Starting point
Question No linked steps
FM Manual Rebooking Scenarios
1. Manual calculation when ticket has extended validity Step 3
2. Manual calculation when you receive msg *RB and OB is �own Step 6
3. Manual calculation when your booking is purged but the ticket is open Step 2
4. Manual calculation for a nego fare ticket Step 4
5. Manual calculation when you are not getting correct fare family Step 5
Step 2
Solution Parent step: 1
Manuel calculation when your booking is purged but the ticket is open
When your booking is purged, but the ticket is open, you need to make a new PNR. 
You should be able to go ahead and do this with an ATC. You can use both Amadeus and Sabre tickets and
make the new PNR in Amadeus. You will �nd the ticket number in Edvin or in the history of the ticket.
This is the ticket and the status is open.
Create a new PNR, adding some mandatory �elds.
Name:
NM1EKLUND/LARS MR (If more than one name NM1EKLUND/LARS MR 1EKLUND/LENA MRS)
Email:
APE-LARS@GMAIL.COM
Phone:
APM-+467025555555
Ticketing arrangement element
TKOK
Before adding the ticket number you need to add the new itinerary.
Add the ticket number:
> F H E 1 1 7 - 3 8 5 3 2 1 3 2 6 0 

Now you can go ahead and do your ATC command. FXO/R,UP and you will �nd the reissue image.
Then just 'ER' and charge the customer if any payment needed or send the new PNR to ticketing for issue.
**Remember always to link the PNR in Edvin.
(For an EMD-number just add it with FHDxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxx, for instance a voucher or a bag.)
If an ATC is not working just go ahead with doing a manual calculation, in this case using FXX, and compare it
with the original ticket. If a manual calculation is needed, always remember to check the fare rules or the TA
pages.
Step 3
Solution Parent step: 1
Manual calculation when ticket has extended validity
When you need to make a manual calculation, and the validity of your ticket is extended according to TA, but
you can't �nd any prices to compare with when you're backdating with FXX or FQP. Most tickets are only valid
for 1 year maximum so in these cases you need to make a fake return to �nd a price.

This is a ticket where the outbound is �own, the ticket was issued 06apr21.
Let's pretend you want to rebook the inbound to 28 Apr next year
You pick the same booking class as in the original ticket or the �rst available to the left, in this case, T-class.

Then use the command FXX/r,up,06apr21/s2,3,6,7 for historical pricing (Backdating)
And this is the error message you get:
This is because the ticket was issued on 06 Apr and only valid for 1 year.  
Since the ticket was issued on 06 Apr we need to make a fake inbound for a date as close as possible before
that date to get a valid price. You will pick the same booking class as you had available on the requested �ight
28 Apr, so in this case T-class.
Then use the command FXX/r,up,06apr21/s2,3,6,7 for historical pricing (Back dating)
And this is the result you get:

Now you can go ahead and do the manual calculation comparing the original ticket with the pricing for the
fake return price image.
Remember to be very clear in your notes when sending this to Ticketing.   
Step 4
Solution Parent step: 1
Manual calculation for a nego fare ticket
When you need to make a manual calculation, and your ticket is in nego fare, missing fare and total.
This is the ticket and it was issued 03jun21:

Let's pretend you want to rebook this inbound to 20 JUN:
The ATC is not working, and you need to continue with a manual calculation. You will then use the command
FXP/R,U/S2,3 (instead of R,UP you will just add R,U to get the “unpublished” prices, called nego fares.). A nego
ticket has to be rebooked to another nego price (there are exceptions, TK for instance) 
This will be your result:

Since we don't have the fare of the original ticket, then you need to check the TST with the command TQT. If
you get this error message, you need to proceed to the TST history with the command TTH.
NO ACTIVE TST - DELETED TST RECORDS MAY EXIST - PLEASE USE TTH 
In the TST history, you will �nd all pricing details for the original ticket, and you can go ahead doing your
manual calculating comparing old ticket price and today price.
  
This is also possible to use when a PNR is purged, just use RPP/RLC-XXXXXX and then RPP/TTH  
Step 5
Solution Parent step: 1
Manual calculation and you are not getting correct fare family
When you need to make a manual calculation, and you are not getting the original fare family when using
FXX 

This is the ticket, and we have a FB KEUCLSP3, with LH-group CL stands for “classic”. The ticket is including
1PC.
Let's pretend we want to rebook the inbound to 30 Aug:
We price it with FXX/R;UP/S,4 and this is the result we are getting.
As you can see, we have the FB we want on option 2 for the outbound, but the plus sign indicates we have
another FB for the inbound. We have classic on outbound and light on inbound as you see further down:

If you open option 2 with FQQ02 you will see this:
So we have no options with classic on OB and IB. But this is easy to change. Use FXX/R,UP/S2,4/FF-CLASSIC and
you will �nd the correct FB.
You can also use FXX/R,UP/A-KEUCLSP3 with the same result.

You can use this with every airline that works with fare families, but of course all airlines have their own
name of di�erent fares, for instance SAS is calling their light ticket GOLIGHT, but it works the same way. 
Step 6
Solution Parent step: 1
Manual calculation when you receive msg *RB and OB is �own
When you need to make a manual calcul

ATH, UPA, BOM, CNX and WNS:

The payment link can be removed from the FL agent/ support agent once the request is sent to

input:

FL/ SC- Live 10FEB22, last update 14MAR22

Step 1 - Starting point
Question No linked steps
Tech Alerts
As many of you may know, when an airline changes something in the PNR, we get a notiﬁcation in our system. 
For example, schedule change notiﬁcation (UN/TK) or when the airline exchanges a ticket. However, we do 
have cases where there is a technical error in the airline's system, and they have to notify us of a change they 
have had while the aircraft were still in operation. For such cases, the airline provides us with a special policy 
for a speciﬁc route and date that we must follow.
In the need to inform all parties involved of such errors a new category (Attribute) has been created in the 
Edvin Documents/Schedule Change tab, that will include the proper airline  policy to follow.
Until now, the schedule change agent had to check the ﬂight status in GDS to identify the schedule change 
and inform the passenger about the possible alternatives, based on the Edvin Documents for SC Policies. 
Now having in mind the possibility of a technical error, we should follow the below:
1. Open order in Edvin.
2. Open PNR in GDS and check ﬂight status and ﬂight number.
3. Open the Edvin Docs, ﬁrst checking whether there is a new technical error under the attribute ‘Tech 
Alert’ that aﬀects that speciﬁc ﬂight in the PNR for the speciﬁc period mentioned.
a. If this is indeed a ‘Tech Alert’ please follow the instructions of that category and not the 
normal SC policy. 

b. If the ﬂight details do not match with the ‘Tech Alert’ information, please proceed with any 
alternatives that can be provided as per the Schedule Change policy or Covid-19.
The information will be shared:
1. With the SC team through an email.
2. Through Edvin Documents in SC tab.
3. Through Shelf- SC folder- Tech Alerts.
ATTENTION: In case the instructions are not followed, ADMs will be issued from the airline(s).
Choose your Tech Alerts
1. SAS - SK6943/SK6944 - 01MAR22-26MAR22 - CPH-ORD-CPH Step 2
2. AC- Air Canada class realignment changes - starting 22nd Feb and 17 March 2022 Step 3
3. Scoot (TR) has re-numbered the following Scoot operated services, codeshare by Singapore
Airlines

original seats held were no longer conﬁrmed.

Step 2
Solution Parent step: 1
Basic info / Good to know
What is Schedule change (SC)?
Any modi�cation to the �ight schedule before the departure date due to the airline's operational reasons.
Examples:
Change of time schedule, �ight number
Misconnection
Additional stop
Airport change
What is Force Majeure (FM)?
Unforeseeable circumstances that prevent the airline from operating the �ight
Examples:
Epidemic/Pandemic(COVID-19)
Damage to the infrastructure due to an extraordinary situation(Blast in Beirut)
Natural disaster(Tsunami, Typhoon, Earthquake, etc)
Strike 
Bankruptcy
Air tra�c congestion
For more information please click here.
Di�erence between SC and FM
Schedule change is a general policy provided by the airline for involuntary handling scenarios. On the
other hand, for Force Majeure scenario airline's provide exceptional policies and guidelines due to
extraordinary events, based on certain criteria, such as travel date or route.
In the event of a �ight change due to an airline noti�cation or an extraordinary event occurring as
mentioned by the customer, the agent should review Edvin Document with the following order to
determine the appropriate policy: 
a) Covid19
b) FM / Travel Alerts
c) Tech Error
d) Schedule change
Step 3
Solution Parent step: 1
IATA areas & sub-areas
IATA AREAS 
IATA SUBAREAS
What is an airport city code? 
An IATA airport code, also known as an IATA location identi�er, IATA station code, or simply a location
identi�er, is a three-character alphanumeric geocode designating many airports and metropolitan areas
around the world, de�ned by the International Air Transport Association (IATA).
Please click here to check all the airport codes in CCRA website and here on IATA website.
What is a city code? 
The IATA, the FAA (US Federal Aviation Administration), and various booking engines have assigned "city
codes" which represent several airports serving a metropolitan area. Not every region served with
multiple airports is assigned a location identi�er, however, nor are all IATA-recognized facilities
necessarily included; furthermore, the inclusion or exclusion of a facility may depend on the booking
system.
For example, the IATA: NYC code, represents the New York City area, including �ights to John F Kennedy
International Airport IATA: JFK, Newark Liberty International Airport IATA: EWR and LaGuardia Airport IATA:
LGA. In some systems, Westchester County Airport IATA: HPN is also included; however, IATA: ZYP (New
York Penn Station), IATA: ISP (Islip Airport), and IATA: JRA (West 30th Street Heliport) are generally not.

             1: Finalized - when we have ﬁnalized all actions expected towards the customer’s request

             2: Awaiting customer - when we have done our needed interaction with the customer and

their response
             4: Internal investigation - when supervisor needs to make his internal investigation before
coming back to the customers' request.

expectations given to the customer and meet our SLAs.
             6: Pax not reached post Follow up - in scenarios where Coordinators/TLs have followed all
the steps and attempts for follow up based on the process and yet have not reached the customer.

What's going on with Edvin remarks and automatic delete of air segments?
For all orders that we send out Bulk Emails to, we are working on an automated function for the ones that
Accept the Open Ticket option.
This function will:
1-Delete ﬂight segments
2- Add retention line
3- Add remarks
Another automated function is in Edvin:
1-Order note that we have sent email to customer.
2-Order note when customer has answered 
3-If customer accepts option 1/Open Ticket -  the Order Status will be updated to Changed with change
reason "COVID-19 Open ticket/Voucher conﬁrmed" (if order is previously Cancelled - status will not be
updated to Changed)
Above automation was delayed but all orders where customers have accepted the option, will be run trough
scripts in Amadeus and Sabre and above steps. Farelogix is still a work in progress and estimated live date
will be April 14th. Until then, all orders will still have the ﬂight segments in them. It is ok to delete the ﬂight
segments in Farelogix and leave the booking as it is, no retention line is possible to add in Farelogix. and
nothing happens if you delete the segments before the script does.
UPDATE (9 April 11) - All orders where customer answered YES to Open ticket have been runned trough GDS
Script (Ama and Sabre) And until automation is fully live, this script will run every 24h with customers who
have answered YES  after April 9th 10:00 SE time.
For Edvin notes: system is looking for customer answers every 6 hours and update with Edvin notes/Status
updates whenever a customer answer is detected.

Void
General info

For orders with departure �ights within 3 days (0-3 days), we have up to 60 minutes from the time of
booking creation to cancel the tickets with a full refund.
For orders with departure �ights more than 3 days, we ONLY have up to 12 hours from the time of
booking creation to cancel the tickets with a full refund. After 12 hours the airline's penalty will apply
according to the rules. 
If we pass the 12 hours from the time of booking creation and we are on the same day of the ticket issuance:
NO full refund is provided. If a full refund is possible the system will allow us to do so.
The portal does not support the VOID function. For tech restrictions, we consider the policy void-like, however,
in case of cancellation FL agents need to "Modify order" with the reason "24H Rule" if a full refund was
provided.
We should not choose the Void reason in Modify Order. 
Steps
1. Click on the �ight number and then "All Flights Cancel". Click "OK" on the pop-up noti�cation:
2. On the next page, the refund details (penalty, etc.) will be displayed:

3. Inform the customer about the PENALTY amount (if any) and our fee. 
If we are in a full refund period, then we will be able to cancel without the airline’s fee.
If we see an airline fee, then we are NOT in a Full Refund period but cancellation by the rules.
4. If the customer con�rms the refund then select "Approve" so that the tickets will be refunded and air
segments will be removed at once. 
 Please do NOT insert any Cancel Reason.
All ancillaries (for example: baggage or seat) will be refunded as well during the Full Refund process,
meaning that the system will auto-calculate the amounts.

Note: If our fee is higher than the refundable amount, and the customer con�rms the cancellation,
the agent should still cancel and refund in the portal, as the refunded amount goes to ETG, and
shall not be in the queue for the refund to the customer. Do NOT "Modify order" in such a
scenario, as no refund to the customer. Instead, press "Cancel Order" with the reason "Ticket rules
- no refund to customer".
5. After we click on "Approve" we will get the below pop-up noti�cation: 
6. Now, you can click on "Show PNR" in order to check that the �ights have been canceled:
7. The status of the PNR is: Canceled and there are no �ights in the PNR.
8. In case you want to see all the transactions, including purchasing and refunding the order, you can go to
"Payment log history":

5. Go to Edvin, "Modify order" with the reason "24H Rule" If a full refund was provided, in the ‘’Other info to
BO’’ box add note TKT REFUNDED (always include the tkt number) and send cancellation con�rmation using
the cancellation template from Edvin (CXL conf. - �ight void/24h).

24 - Hour BR Cancellation process
Due to applicable law for the BR market, we always need to proceed with the full refund without retention of
any fee of the PNR (ticket) whenever the passenger requests the cancellation of the ticket within 24 hours of
purchase and the departure is at least 7 days after the day of purchase. 
The process applies:
- for B.com from 19th September 2023 and is retrospective
- for the rest of the orders from 19th of July 2023 and is retrospective
This is applicable under the following criteria (all should apply):
1. Market/Itinerary/Residence:
1. BR site orders � in general, irrespectively of itinerary
2. non-BR site bookings/PNRs � for �ights arriving in Brazil, if made by a Brazilian resident
2. Cancellation within 24h from the time of purchase 
3. Cancellation request received within 24hrs
4. First departure date is at least 7 days after the payment date.ex. if I book today, 7th of JUL, the departure
date should be not earlier than 14th of JUL, if the departure date is 14th of JUL it still should be cancelled
for free, if  departure date 13th of JUL - 24h BR free cancellation  doesn't apply) 
5. First issue tickets only, cannot be applied to reissued tickets.
24h BR cancellation
Cancellation reason applies per PNR/ticket. Passengers are eligible for 24h BR cancellation if they want to
proceed with partial cancellation in case of a multi-NPR order.The conditions must always apply on PNR
level.

Outbound Call - General process
How to correctly perform an outbound call Remember always to start a new outgoing interaction on behalf of the respective queue is presented in the below steps. Only in this way, the number that will be presented to the customer will be the one connected to the chosen queue and therefore relevant to the respective market. 
 If you don’t start the interaction on behalf of the queue and you simply dial the customer’s number, not only our number appearing on the receiver’s device will be incorrect, but also some additional features may not be available during the call.
1. Choose ithe nteraction option from the left-hand menu:
2. Press on the ‘+’ icon to start a new interaction:
  3. Fill in the pop-up window by selecting the correct queue, depending on the market, where the booking was created: 
Note that you are able to choose only between the queues, for which you are set as active:
  4. Add the number that you want to call and press ENTER.  
You have to press the enter button in order for the phone icon to turn green. Only then you will be able topress the phone icon and perform a call on behalf of the queue:

Stop recording
If the customer/supplier does not approve the call recording or cannot understand the language (for example customer does not speak English), then press in Genesys ‘’Start/End Secure Pause’’ as shown below:
Always keep in mind that the wrap-up used in this case should be ‘’Non approved rec’’.By selecting the ‘’Non approved rec” wrap-up, Genesys will delete the already recorded seconds. 
If an incorrect wrap-up code is used, the recording will not be deleted. Please submit a Jira ticket to IT under "Genesys Cloud Service Desk" with the selection of "Service Request" to report the issue and ask them to delete the recording.
Note: For the cases where the customer cannot understand the language, you need to send out anemail, even if it is in English, to resolve the case.

Call Recordings
Starting May 24th, 2022 we will make changes on how we record calls in Genesys Cloud. We will record allcalls that don't opt out of recording and secure pause the part when the customer is waiting in the queue.
The secure pause will end automatically when the agent answers the call. This also means that the agent willget a noti�cation when they answer that the secure pause ended.The secure pause button will change from red to gray when the secure pause ends.
If the agent declines the call or doesn't answer in time the agent will also get a noti�cation error message. "Anunknown error has occurred while executing the call" is expected and we have not found a way to hide thismessage for the agent.
